results.title: How solid is rock?
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Provides a series of investigations which will lead to an understanding of the behaviour of rock. Shows how a rapid rate of deformation in rock produces fracturing while a slow rate produces flow. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: How should we remember Stuart?
results.creator_credit: Kath Ensor, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her grandmother, Elizabeth, Kath Ensor remembers her grandfather, Stuart. Encompassing his time serving in the RAAF during World War II, his love for his family and his positive attitude, despite experiencing ill health.

results.title: How seeds are scattered
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “E.F.V.A. Primary Botany”.
Designed for primary schools, shows how plants produce flowers and then fruits which contain seeds. Different kinds of fruits and seeds - runner beans, laburnum tree, willow seeds, thistles, sycamore tree, are used to illustrate methods of dispersal by wind, water and animals.

results.title: How seeds are made
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “E.F.V.A. Primary Botany”.
The structure of flowers is explained with close-ups to show the male and female parts, stamens and stigma. Insects are seen visiting many different flowers, both wild and cultivated. Close-ups illustrate very clearly the relationship between the shapes of flowers and the shapes of the insects which pollinate them. Wind pollinated flowers are also shown, and their pollen grains, much magnified, are compared with those of the insect-pollinated flowers. An animated diagram makes clear the process of fertilisation which follows pollination.

results.title: How safe is surgery?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Surgeons today perform operations which would have seemed miraculous only a few years ago; but even now, a century after Joseph Lister published the first accounts of his revolutionary technique of antiseptic surgery, infection after operations is a menace, probably costing the Health Service six million pounds a year. Investigates both the techniques used to prevent infection during an actual operation and research into the causes of infection which still trouble British hospitals. Reporter: Christopher Chataway.

results.title: How raw sugar is made from cane
results.brief_description: Shows all stages in the manufacture of raw sugar from cane; initial crushing of the cane; extraction of raw sugar from the juice; the bagging and storage of the raw product and finally its transport for shipment. The film stresses the importance of the sugar industry in the economy of Australia.
results.title_for_label: How raw sugar is made from cane

results.title: How quest sought the truth
results.brief_description: Nathan Jurevicius has a unique and delightful animation style. How Quest sought the Truth is adapted from the Croatian Fairy story by Ivana Brlic Mazuranic. It tells the story of Witting and his three grandsons who live in the Forest. The grandson venture out to seek the wisdom of Alrosy but are tempted from their path by goblins. Quest eventually finds his way back.

results.title: How plants move
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “E.F.V.A. Primary Botany”.
Uses plants such as cress, beans, shamrocks and marrows to illustrate plant responses to light, gravity, water, day and night and touch. Time-lapse photography shows plant movements in detail. Gives a close-up examination of the trapping action of the venus fly-trap. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “E.F.V.A. Primary Botany”.
Uses plants such as cress, beans, shamrocks and marrows to illustrate plant responses to light, gravity, water, day and night and touch. Time-lapse photography shows plant movements in detail. Gives a close-up examination of the trapping action of the venus fly-trap. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: How plants help us: observing things around us
results.brief_description: A young boy bicycling to his uncle’s farm observes the plants around him and discovers that plants are helpful in many ways. Explains that people are dependent upon plants for food, clothing, wood, paper, rubber and many other common articles important in their daily lives.
